Hi guys,

I followed this guidelines 

http://webteam.archive.org/confluenc=
e/display/Heritrix/Setting+up+the+new+Heritrix+in+Eclipse

and got Heritrix=
 built successfully in Eclipse 3.3. However, when I
attempt the second step=
 "To run Heritrix plus Web UI via Eclipse", it
fails. 

I set up my program=
 arguments as follow

-hdist/src/main/conf/heritrix.properties
-jdist/src/m=
ain/conf/jobs   
-r

When I run, it terminated and outputed


-------------=
-----------------------------------------------------
heritrix.development =
mode
usage: Heritrix
 -a,--webui-admin           Specifies the authorizatio=
n password which
                            must be supplied to access the=
 webui.
Required if launching the webui.
 -j,--jobs-dir              The jo=
bs directory.  Defaults to ./jobs
 -u,--no-engine             Do not run th=
e crawl engine; only run the
                            admin web UI.
 -r,=
--run-job               Specify a ready job or a profile name to
          =
                  launch at launch.  If you specify a
profile name, the pro=
file will first
                            be copied to a new ready job, a=
nd that
ready job will be launched.
 -w,--webui-war-path        The path to=
 the Heritrix webui WAR.
 -p,--webui-port            The port the webui sho=
uld listen on.
 -l,--logging-properties    The full path to the logging pro=
perties file
                            (eg, conf/logging.properties).  If=

present, this file will be used to
                            configure J=
ava logging.  Defaults to
./conf/logging.properties
 -b,--webui-bind-hosts =
     A comma-separated list of hostnames for the
                          =
  webui to bind to.
 -n,--no-web-ui             Do not run the admin web us=
er interface; only
                            run the crawl engine.  If se=
t, the crawl
engine will need to be controlled
                            =
via JMX or a remote web UI.
 -h,--help                  Usage information.
=

------------------------------------------------------------------

also, =
what does it mean 'bundled profiles" in 

-j[suitable folder for jobs creat=
ed when testing Heritrix, make sure
it exists and contains bundled profiles=


Thanks,

-k
